listCustomFeats.name: Animate Ice
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You sculpt a statue out of ice and breathe a semblance of life into it, allowing it to fight on your side. The ice statue is Small or Medium and appears in an unoccupied space adjacent to you.
The ice statue uses your statistics for defenses, and has Hit Points equal to five times your level. It’s mindless and immune to bleed, cold, healing, paralyzed, poison, and sleep. It can't attack except to make a melee Strike, which uses your statistics for a 1-action ranged Elemental Blast using the ice element.
The ice statue lasts until the end of your next turn, but you can Sustain it up to 1 minute. When you use the impulse and the first time you Sustain it each round, you can have the ice statue Stride up to 30 feet and make a melee Strike. If you use Animate Ice again, any previous one ends.
Level (12th) The ice statue can be Small, Medium, or Large.
Level (16th) The ice statue can be Small, Medium, Large, or Huge.
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Manipulate, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Aura Junction (Ice)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Killing frost stiffens the limbs of foes around you. Any enemy that starts its turn in the aura gets a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.

listCustomFeats.name: Critical Blast Junction (Ice)
listCustomFeats.textDescription: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets frozen to the surface. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to tear itself free. The creature doesn't get frozen if it's incorporeal or could otherwise escape without effort.

listCustomFeats.name: Ice Armor
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Sheets of brittle ice cover you like armor. This ice armor is medium armor but uses your highest armor proficiency. The ice armor’s statistics are: AC Bonus +3; Dex Cap +2; Check Penalty –2; Speed Penalty –5 feet; Strength 2; Bulk 2; Group composite; Armor Traits laminar. Any bonuses, runes, and magical abilities of your actual armor are suppressed, but any that could apply to the ice armor are replicated onto it.
As a reaction, when an enemy within melee reach hits you with a Strike, you may deal 1d4 cold damage with a basic Reflex save against your class DC to the triggering enemy as the sheets of ice explode in its face. If less than 1 round passed since you used the reaction, the ice armor gains the broken condition, or is destroyed if it was already broken.
The impulse lasts for 10 minutes, and you can Dismiss this impulse. If you use this impulse again, any existing one ends.
Level (+3) The damage increases by 1d4.
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Ice Barrier
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Trigger A creature hits you with an attack and you can see the attacker
You conjure a thin sheet of ice between you and the triggering enemy, deflecting the blow and gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack still hits you, the sheet shatters, blunting the strike, and you gain resistance to fire or physical damage from the triggering attack equal to half your level. If the effect deals more than one applicable type of damage, apply the resistance only once. If you’re under the Ice Armor impulse, you may use its reaction as part of this impulse
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Ice Element (Anomalous Gates)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You draw your power from an isolated pocket in the Plane of Water, perhaps near the border with the Plane of Air, where violent winds may freeze your flesh solid before eroding it away or great glacier islands house ecosystems of ice elementals and stranger creatures still.
Impulse Junction Snow flutters around you, causing you to become concealed for 1 round.
Blast Damage 1d8 cold or piercing, 30 foot range.
Extract Element cold
Critical Blast Junction If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets frozen to the surface. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to tear itself free. The creature doesn't get frozen if it's incorporeal or could otherwise escape without effort.
Elemental Resistance cold, fire
Aura Junction Killing frost stiffens the limbs of foes around you. Any enemy that starts its turn in the aura gets a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.
Skill Junction Stealth, Terrain Stalker (snow)
Versatile Blast bludgeoning
Elemental Form Ice 25 feet, ice burrow 20 ft; cold resistance 10, weakness 5 to fire; Melee � claw (Strength based), Damage 1d10 slashing plus 1d8 cold Gate Attenuator Spells 1st snowball; 5th howling blizzard; 8th arctic rift;
Additional impulses: 1st Winter’s Clutch, 4th Winter Sleet, 12th Glacial Prison, 14th Barrier of Boreal Frost.
listCustomFeats.traits: Kineticist, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Ice Sculpture
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You can create a permanent ice object, either sculpting ice pulled directly from your kinetic gate or manipulating ice and snow around you. It must fit within one 5-foot cube that's adjacent to you and on solid ground, and you can make the object large enough to occupy the square. If you create the object underneath you or another willing creature, you cause the target to rise on top of the object; you can't create it under an unwilling creature. This impulse has an unlimited duration and the resulting object is protected from environmental heat, but if you use Ice Sculpture again, the object thaws or shatters immediately. You can spend 1 hour to use Ice Sculpture as an exploration activity; in this case, the object is permanent and non-magical, and thaws normally. The object can't include any intricate parts or moving pieces. You can attempt a Crafting skill check as part of using this impulse to add details to your creation, such as a symbol, short message, or pattern (with the DC determined by the GM).
Level (+3) You can add an additional 5-foot cube to the object. Each cube must be contiguous.

listCustomFeats.textDescription: Snow flutters around you, causing you to become concealed for 1 round.

listCustomFeats.name: Winter Sleet (Ice Element)
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Bone-chilling, swirling sleet surrounds you, cruel as deepest winter. Surfaces in your kinetic aura are coated in slippery ice. A creature that moves on the ice immediately falls unless it succeeds at an Acrobatics check or Reflex save against your impulse DC – 2. A creature that Steps or Crawls doesn’t have to attempt a check or save. You’re immune to this effect.

If a creature on the ice is critically hit by one of your water impulses or critically fails at a save against one, that creature is slowed 1 until the end of its next turn.
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Primal, Stance, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Arctic Palace of Everlasting Winter
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You can raise a magnificent building of clear, magically reinforced ice within 10 feet of you. The palace is shaped and decorated as you choose, up to 30 feet in any dimension. You can imagine a purpose for each room of the palace, and the proper accouterments made of ice appear within. Each story must be at least 10 feet tall from floor to ceiling, each 5 feet of the walls must be placed on the border between squares, and the palace is created with its doors open. The magical ice the palace and the accouterments are made of uses the statistics of stone and is unaffected by environmental heat, but melts immediately if taken outside the palace’s walls; the insides of the palace and the magical ice are always pleasantly cool. You and the creatures you designate can walk on the palace's ice as if it was stone, ignoring the uneven ground and difficult terrain. The palace lasts until your next daily preparations, or until you use the Arctic Palace of Everlasting Winter again.
As a magical structure, the palace has the structure trait, and it expands outward, so it can’t catch creatures except for you inside it as a magical structure normally does. Instead, it pushes those creatures back. It can’t push a creature into a surface or hazard this way, and stops expanding if that would happen.
While inside the palace, you are empowered, dealing an additional 1d6 cold damage with all Strikes, spells that deal cold damage, and impulses that deal cold damage, and gaining a +1 status bonus to Armor Class, attack rolls, and saving throws.
You can spend 10 minutes to use the Arctic Palace of Everlasting Winter as an exploration activity; in this case, the palace is permanent, can occupy a space up to 300 feet in any direction, and has no restriction on the size of the floors and the placement of walls, though it still ends if you use the Arctic Palace of Everlasting Winter as an exploration activity again.
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Overflow, Primal, Structure, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Winter's Clutch
listCustomFeats.traits: Kineticist, Ice, Impulse, Cold, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Flashfrost Gate
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
A small doorway directly to the heart of everlasting winter opens but for a fleeting moment, sucking all heat from everything around it. Each creature in a 15-foot burst within 90 feet takes 3d10 cold damage with a basic Fortitude save against your class DC. A creature that critically fails its save is drained 1.
Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d10.
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Overflow, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Frozen Heart
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You channel the lethal frost directly through your enemy’s flesh, starting from its heart. Target a creature you can observe within 30 feet. It takes 6d8 cold damage with a basic Fortitude save against your class DC, and is drained 1 on a failure or drained 2 on a critical failure.
If the target’s level is equal to or lower than your level – 4 and it fails the save, it dies instantly. A foe killed by this impulse turns into a statue of ice.
Level (+2) The cold damage increases by 1d8.
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Death, Impulse, Kineticist, Overflow, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Hail Blast
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
Small shards of ice form in the sky, falling on your foes. Each creature in a 10-foot radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder within 60 feet of you takes 1d4 cold damage and 1d4 piercing damage with a basic Reflex save against your class DC.
Level (+2) Each type of damage increases by 1d4.
listCustomFeats.traits: Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Overflow, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Cold Comfort
listCustomFeats.textDescription: Ice gathers around your allies, numbing them to the harshness of the world. You and allies in your kinetic aura gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level, and again at the start of each of their turns, as well as cold and fire resistance equal to your level. The temporary Hit Points last until the impulse ends. If an enemy hits a creature that has temporary Hit Points from this impulse with a melee unarmed attack or non-reach melee weapon attack, the enemy takes cold damage equal to half your level. Elemental resistance from a gate junction is cumulative with resistance from Cold Comfort.
listCustomFeats.traits: Aura, Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Manipulate, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Fimbulvetr
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You summon deadly, apocalyptic winter, freezing everything around you. You are surrounded by an aura of winter in a 100-foot emanation, filled with howling wind, blinding snow, and freezing chill. All creatures in the aura are concealed, and all creatures outside the aura become concealed to creatures within it. The wind and show in the aura impede movement, making the area difficult terrain. You’re immune to the concealment and difficult terrain from Fimbulvetr.
The impulse lasts until the end of your next turn, and you can Sustain the impulse up to 1 minute. When you use the impulse and the first time you Sustain it each round, each enemy in the aura takes 8d6 cold damage with a basic Reflex save against your class DC.
Level (20th) The damage increases to 10d6.
listCustomFeats.traits: Aura, Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Overflow, Primal, 3rd Party

listCustomFeats.name: Hiemal Blade
listCustomFeats.textDescription:
You gather the frost surrounding you into a colossal bladed weapon and rush, scything through your foes. Step or Stride up to 15 feet. At any point during the movement, you may attempt a 2-action melee Elemental Blast using the ice element, adding an additional 1 cold damage, and compare the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within your melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature you hit. A Hiemal Blade counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty.
You may treat Hiemal Blade as a melee Elemental Blast for purposes of Weapon Infusion, and if you add the sweep trait with the Weapon Infusion, its modifier applies to all your Hiemal Blade attacks.
Level (+3) The additional cold damage increases by 1d8 and the maximum length of the Stride increases by 5 feet.
listCustomFeats.traits: Attack, Cold, Impulse, Kineticist, Primal, 3rd Party
